meanings.definition: To divide or distribute something among a group of people.
meanings.sent1: We were divvying up the snacks for the party.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were divvying the chores between them.
meanings.sent3: The friends were divvying up the last slice of pizza like it was a treasure.
meanings.sent4: She was divvying her time between work and family like a skilled juggler.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was divvying out the crayons, making sure each student had enough.

meanings.definition: To share or split something, especially money or resources.
meanings.sent1: They were divvying the earnings from the garage sale.
meanings.sent2: The team was divvying the supplies for the camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The kids were divvying their Halloween candy with big smiles.
meanings.sent4: He was divvying his attention between his two favorite hobbies.
meanings.sent5: The committee was divvying the responsibilities for the event, ensuring fairness.
